website_summaries.verdict: The Reebok Yourflex Train 10 MT was lauded for being lightweight, comfortable, and versatile for everyday training. Other highlights included its inexpensive price, durable build, trendy style, and lightweight nature. Despite the acclaim, the trainer had its own share of flaws. It was purported to be small and narrow, uncomfortable, and hard-soled. But most buyers deemed it a great-performing footgear for its price.
pros: Most buyers were impressed by the comfort that the Reebok Yourflex Train 10 MT provided
Budget-conscious consumers were amazed at the affordable price tag of the trainer
Numerous testers thought that it had quality materials and construction
The footwear’s athletic style received a myriad of compliments from the purchasers
Fitness buffs praised it for being an all-around footgear for both lifting and high-impact activities
A handful of users noted that the pair felt light on the feet
The plush cushioning pleased some of the wearers
cons: Various critics were annoyed that the model ran smaller than usual
The shoe is rife with complaints about the narrow width
Multiple naysayers criticized its uncomfortable overlays digging into the top of the foot
A few individuals griped about the hard midsole

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a sneaker head, but I do have like 6 pairs of similar looking Reebok sneakers in different styles/colors. These ones are probably the best longevity wise (I've had them for 2 months thus far). They are holding up really well, and are really comfortable. Maybe its just my perception, but it seems because of the "Memory Tech sock liner" (it has bumpy texture) the feet stay cooler throughout the day. Will definitely be getting another pair soon in different color pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good workout shoe
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I ordered these because the price was right. A little worried about fit, but they fit true to size. Super light shoe with spongy sole. I am currently using in location with a lot of gravel and paths and sometime I can fell larger rocks through the sole. I use to workout, have not run in them although I'm sure would be fine for short runs (5K). Shoe fit flat to surface, steady ankle makes it good for working out/crossfit. Not sure if it matter to some but the insole is not removable. I'm very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: zero support, made like crap... THEY SUCK
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten no-names at Famous Footwear that were better made than these. it was torture walking in them. They pinch in the front and are sloppy as hell in the back. If you have flat feet, don't even bother. These are more like punishment to wear. And also not even a month after I got them, they were falling apart. Bottom line: THEY SUCK.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Templar

customer_reviews.title: Super narrow shoes
customer_reviews.text: I used to use Reebok cross trainers for decades. They're no longer really around in most retail outlets so I gave these a shot. Seems like good build quality but I have no idea who these things are built for, my foot is bulging out the side of the shoe and I get blisters if I try to walk or run in them for longer than 20 minutes. Maybe a good fit for others but apparently I can't use Reebok anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to wear at my Kickboxing/Krav Maga class. good support for the workout. Occasionally, we have to do sprits outside on the street, and these shoes held up fairly well doing that. Though they are cross-trainers, I don't think they'd do too well in running more than that. one negative is that the insole seems a little thick (it's thick maybe for comfort). overall, very good shoe
customer_reviews.author: JKB

customer_reviews.title: My husband is obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: My husband found these shoes several years ago and will now only buy these specific Reebok tennis shoes. To date, he has bought at least eight pair of the exact same shoes. He says they are the perfect fit, the memory foam sole inside the shoe makes standing for long periods of time or playing with our grandson comfortable and pain free. His only concern is when he will not be able to find this version any more.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Its about whats Inside
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are slightly narrow. The biggest issue is that the inside is lined with these foam bumps. I guess that is supposed to massage your feet? Well it doesn't. It just makes it feel uncomfortable while you're trying to exercise. You're better off looking for another type of shoe.
customer_reviews.author: xLaXome

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It has a higher price tag than other options. But I found the sizing and comfort to be exactly what I needed for my occasional basement DVD workouts. I bought a larger size to add plantar fasciitis inserts, My heels do not pop out when I walk, so they also do nicely on the indoor track at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cross training
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the shoes so far. I was looking for some Cross training shoes that where comfortable but not super fluffy so I could lift weights with it, and these shoes are the perfect commitment between lifting and running for WOD's that call for both.
customer_reviews.author: C-bass

customer_reviews.title: nice but not really great
customer_reviews.text: nice but not really great. I guess I'm just a little gun shy after the last pair of Reeboks I bought that fell apart. Not from this vendor, they were great and the service was prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Worst running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have been an exclusive user of Reebok shoes for many years. My previous experience has been very good. Not this time, these are the worst running shoes that I have bought, they are uncomfortable, they have a terrible arch support, and they are too narrow. After a few minutes I feel tired, with a horrible pain in my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando S. Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable but I had to buy a full size bigger
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable but I had to buy a full size bigger. Once I got the right fit, these are awesome to wear and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: C_TexLive

customer_reviews.title: Not a comfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe because I had previously bought some in this series. The new shoe was too tight across the arch (I don't even lace them up tightly, just to where I can slip them on). All day wear of these shoes gave me pain across my arch. The insole not great either, I preferred the cushioned sole of the previous models, especially for the back of the foot.
customer_reviews.author: sjpratt

customer_reviews.title: The shoe support
customer_reviews.text: First off I love Reebok especially the extra padded ones they always feel great on my feet. I already had a pair of these Reebok so I already knew how they should feel and they are as advertised great fit great shoe also great delivery. Thank you so much I will be buying more in the future from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Simon

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is very light,comfortable, and looks great. A little tight. Maybe next time go a half size up.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable sneakers
customer_reviews.text: We bought shoes like this once and loved them so much that whenever this brand and type of sneaker wears out, my husband gets a new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen

customer_reviews.title: Used product
customer_reviews.text: Nice sneaker. It was obviously these were a worn and returned item. Disappointed it wasn’t disclosed in the description. We thought we were buying new. Kept them, but disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy from AZ

customer_reviews.title: Work well for cross training
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are a great deal for $38! They fit well, and are comfortable. Note: These are not running shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Ed C

customer_reviews.title: A must buy - very comfy
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable shoes I ever had. They have cushions inside and are extremely light. Good product Rebook!!
customer_reviews.author: Armin

customer_reviews.title: snug
customer_reviews.text: I like the insoles, a bit snug but I have a wide foot used for working out
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Comfort it outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son which is doing cross fit training and he said they're the softest - cushiony - heavenly feeling shoes ever felt!
customer_reviews.author: Dene

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these a few months ago for workout shoes. They are very comfortable and supportive. They are great in the gym on lifting days and grip the platforms well. They also are comfortable enough to wear while coaching every day. Would highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: chris mcclure

customer_reviews.title: Sizing Issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe because I liked my original pair so well. I ordered the exact shoe but in a different color. The new Shoe is more narrow across the toe area. I hope through use it will stretch. I did not have this situation with the original.
customer_reviews.author: Surferrich

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for weightlifting/gym environment
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace some Under Armour trainers for the gym environment. I’ve been really pleased with them so far. Good fit. Snug but forgiving. Great ankle support. I do a lot of deadlifting and squats and these are good shoes for support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: After wearing them my feet were hurting
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Inferior quality product.. I think I will never buy shoes from any website.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay Patel

customer_reviews.title: Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These were for my brother n law. He loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzybar

customer_reviews.title: Not for every day use but a good product
customer_reviews.text: Good light shoe to wear on the weekends drys out fast. Wish I could’ve tried it on in a store before I bought it. I have wide feet and it’s a little bit tight.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Does Its Job.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Reebok and Adidas guy, but Reebok wins the Cross Training category, and these did not disappoint...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoe quality
customer_reviews.text: The rubber sole on the toes started wearing off/down the first time I did sled pushes. Estimated life, less than 2 months. They are comfortable, but not built for endurance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: The sole inserts have “massagers” on them. At first I didn’t like them but enjoy them now. Toe box is tight/secure. Very comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for cross-training and some weight lifting. Really comfortable. Not a running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Lopez

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are very comfortable and super light
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very comfortable and super light. The real test will be how long they last, but for the price compared to my last shoes they are a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Its worth the money the upper cushion is soft but the bottom sole is very hard good for just walking around the mall not for running.
customer_reviews.author: rm

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I liked how this shoe fit. However there didn’t seem to be any arch support and they hurt my feet. Sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: payton 34

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic shoe. I've worn them for a week now ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic shoe. I've worn them for a week now and they feel great working out and running. I'd definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Eisel

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot of support
customer_reviews.text: shoes are light, but my feet hurt after wearing them for a day. Couldn't really exercise in them either ... the soles seem soft
customer_reviews.author: BB from ATL

customer_reviews.title: Says it is a nine, however it is much smaller than the other nine from another vendor
customer_reviews.text: Product Says it is a nine, however it is much smaller than the other nine from another vendor
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Roldan

customer_reviews.title: ... numerous styles of this shoe and have been very satisfied overall.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought numerous styles of this shoe and have been very satisfied overall.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Order half a size larger
customer_reviews.text: Would only recommend to other kid ordering half a size up from typical fit.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Súper confortable
customer_reviews.text: Super confortable , i use it only for workout at the gym .
customer_reviews.author: joel alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like the color of these, and it really is a nice looking sneaker..
customer_reviews.author: Mike c.

customer_reviews.title: It's very good looking and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It's great to wear for the gym and casual outgoing
customer_reviews.author: Bakeer Abdullah

customer_reviews.title: soft
customer_reviews.text: It has fallen apart from the bottom in less then 4 months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rubbing on the right foot.
customer_reviews.text: The memory tech insoles are comfortable and walking in them was comfortable for about a week. After a week there was rubbing on my right foot which has made the shoes very uncomfortable to wear and I am stuck with them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Swelling in my fingers is the smallest pain in my feet
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: Held up fine
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these for months now. In the gym, walking, at work and they have held up really well. They are also comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: James Mann

product_meta.title: Reebok Men's Yourflex Train 10 Mt Cross Trainer
product_meta.description: The yourflex train 10 shoe by Reebok has a microweb upper for support, and a sculpted neoprene heel for comfort. A memory tech sockliner cushions and absorbs shock, while the carbon rubber outsole adds grip and traction where it's needed.
